Dissection of semitendinosus and semimembrinosus muscle from the hind leg of the pig can be performed following the next steps \(Fig.
Position hind leg to a lateral view.
Move skin and adipose tissue layer with scalpel and forceps.
This uncovers the biceps femoris muscle.
Reflection of the biceps femoris muscle \(1) reveals the semitendinosus \(2) and semimembrinosus \(3) at the caudal position.
Transect tendons at both proximal and distal sides while holding one tendon with forceps and transect the other tendon with the scalpel.
Dissected muscle can now be used for stem cell isolation procedures.
PROCEDURE TO ISOLATE SATELLITE CELLS FROM SINGLE FIBERS
Dissect muscle from tendon to tendon,
Place muscle tissue in sterile petri dish in a sterile laminar
Move adipose and connective tissue using scalpels.
Place muscle tissue in preheated \(37°C) 30 ml 0.2% collagenase I solution in a 50 ml tube for 2 hrs in a shaking water bath \(37°C) to
Place digested muscle tissue on HS-coated petri dish and triturate with HS-coated pre-polished Pasteur
Pipette until single fibers detach from tissue.
Transfer fibers to HS-coated petri dish and
Check under a light microscope \(magnification 100X) for remaining tissue debris.
Place single fibers in a freshly HS-coated petri dish containing a low layer of PM and
Transfer a single fiber in the center of Matrigel coated 6-well
Add 200 µl PM per 8-well chamber and
Place chamber slides in incubator \(37°C, 5% CO2).
After 1-2 days satellite cells starts to liberate from the fiber.
Medium does not need to be changed during these days.
During these days satellite cells have migrated from the muscle fiber.
Change PM and allow satellite cell proliferation.
Incubate with PBS for 10 min at 37°C under gentle trituration.
Incubate the cells for 1 hr onto uncoated tissue culture plastic to allow fast-adhesion of fibroblasts \(this is called pre-plating).
Collect cell suspension by centrifugation \(5 min at 300g) and
Plate cells in PM+ to culture plastic to initiate proliferation.
PROCEDURE ISOLATION OF SKELETAL MUSCLE PROGENITOR CELLS
Dissect around 50 g from semitendinosus or semimembrinosus muscle.
Keep on ice in cold PBS+.
Mince muscle tissue in sterile glass petri dish with scalpels in a sterile laminar
Flow culture hood until the tissue is minced into very thin muscle parts.
Collect minced tissue parts in four 50 ml tubes using PBS+ containing 1% HEPES \(v/v) and
Separate supernatant from minced muscle tissue,
Divide minced muscle tissues in five 50 ml tubes.
Add to each 50 ml tube 20 ml 1 mg/ ml Protease dissolved in preheated PBS+ containing 1% HEPES.
Take 50 ml tubes from water bath and triturate digesting tissue 10-15X with 25 and 5 ml pipettes.
Collect tissue debris by mild centrifugation \(5 min at 200g).
Store pelleted tissue temporally on ice and
Adjust supernatant to 50 ml with PBS+ containing 1% HEPES and

Wash cell pellets in PM+ \(10 min at 2000g) 
  CRITICAL
Filter through a 100 µm cell strainer followed by a 70 µm cell strainer.
Wash in PM+ \(10 min at 2000g) and

Continue with tissue debris digestion until the muscle is completely digested: 
  a. Incubate for 60 min in 0.15% w/v collagenase XI in DMEM containing 5% FBS.
b. Triturate with 5 ml and 10 ml pipettes to further grind muscle tissue debris.
c. Transfer tissue debris on 100 µm cell strainer.
d. Centrifuge filtered cell suspension in PM+ \(5 min at 2000g).
e. Separate supernatant from cell pellets and
Collect remaining cells in supernatant \(10 min at 2000g).
Take up in 5 ml PM+ and
Pool pellets I and II in a 50 ml tube and
Centrifuge in cold PBS+ \(10 min at 2000g).
Take up cells in 10 ml PM+ and

Filter through cell strainer with pore size 40 µm. 
    TROUBLE SHOOTING
Adjust with PM+ to 50 ml and
Plate primary muscle cells for removal of fast-adhering fibroblasts \(BOX3).
For storage of cells after pre-plating;
Take up cells in 10 ml cold PM and gradually
Aliquot 1 ml cell suspension in cryovials.
Transfer cryovials \(20x) to pre-chilled \(-20°C) freezing container \(Mr.
Transfer cryovials in liquid nitrogen for long term storage.
All centrifugation steps can be performed at room temperature \(20°C).
Thaw one cryovial from liquid nitrogen at 37°C \(water bath) and
Transfer cell suspension to a 50 ml tube.
Cells can now be plated onto 100 cm2 culture surface.
Cells will adhere to culture plastic during 2 days.
Warm PBS+ and refresh medium PM+ containing 5 ng/ml bFGF.
Cells start to proliferate and will reach 80% confluency after approximately 6 days.
REMARK: Non-adhering cells, adipocytes and dead cells will be removed during this step.
PROCEDURE OF SELECTION FOR THE SIDE POPULATION \(SP)
Wash in cold SP-medium \(20 min at 700g, 4°C).
Optionally, cells can be stored at a density of 2x106 cells/ ml in PM o/n at 4°C.
Filter cell suspension through 40 µm cell strainers and
Take up cells in 5 ml SP-medium \(37°C) at a density of 10x106/ml in a 15 ml tube.
Obtain a concentration of 5 µg/ml and
Transfer 1 ml of Hoechst 33342 cell suspension to eppendorf tube and
Obtain a concentration of 50 µM to
Incubate both Hoechst dye \(+/- verapamil) suspensions for 2 hrs in a shaking water bath \(37°C).
Verapamil is an inhibitor of multidrug resistance transporter like ABG2, discriminates the SP cell from the MP for population sorting
Wash \(20 min at 700g, 4°C) the cell suspensions in 2 ml cold SP-medium and
Sort the SP with a FACS Vantage SE or equivalent sorter \(Fig.
Hoechst dye 33342 excites at 350nm and its fluorescence can be two wavelengths using 450 BP20 \(Hoechst blue) and 675/LP \(Hoechst red) filters.
Collect SP and MP in FBS-coated tubes to avoid cells sticking to the tube wall.
Add cold growth medium to the samples and
Wash the cell population in cold complete growth medium \(20 min at 700g, 4°C) and
Plate cells on Matrigel coated wells plates \(at a density of 1x104 cells/cm2) for cell culture in growth medium in presence of 5 ng/ml bFGF and antibiotics.
